# Pull Request: Add User Login Feature

## Description
This PR implements a complete user authentication system that allows users to securely log into the application with email and password credentials. The login feature includes input validation, error handling, and session management.

## Type of Change
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [ ] Documentation update

## What Changed
- Added `LoginController` to handle authentication logic
- Created `LoginView` component with email and password input fields
- Implemented JWT-based session token generation and storage
- Added `AuthService` for credential validation and user lookup
- Created middleware for protecting authenticated routes
- Added comprehensive error handling for invalid credentials

## Why This Change
Users previously had no way to access personalized features or protect their data. This login system enables secure user identification and allows us to build personalized user experiences and secure endpoints.

## How to Test
1. Navigate to `/login` in your browser.
2. Test with valid credentials:
   - Email: `demo@example.com`
   - Password: `password123`
3. Verify successful login redirects to dashboard.
4. Test invalid credentials and confirm error message displays.
5. Check that session token is stored in local storage.
6. Verify protected routes redirect to login when not authenticated.
7. Test logout clears session and redirects to home page.

## Related Issues

- [x] Any dependent changes have been merged and published

## Screenshots (if applicable)
- Login page with email/password fields
- Success message after login
- Error message for invalid credentials

## Files Changed
- `src/controllers/LoginController.js` - New
- `src/services/AuthService.js` - New
- `src/middleware/authMiddleware.js` - New
- `src/views/LoginView.jsx` - New
- `src/routes/index.js` - Modified
- `tests/LoginController.test.js` - New

- Session tokens expire after 24 hours
- Passwords are hashed using bcrypt before storage
- No breaking changes to existing functionality
